Market for pieces of media"},"userdoc":{"methods":{"acceptBid(uint256,(uint256,address,address,address,(uint256)))":{"notice":"Accepts a bid from a particular bidder. Can only be called by the media contract. See {_finalizeNFTTransfer} Provided bid must match a bid in storage. This is to prevent a race condition where a bid may change while the acceptBid call is in transit. A bid cannot be accepted if it cannot be split equally into its shareholders. This should only revert in rare instances (example, a low bid with a zero-decimal token), but is necessary to ensure fairness to all shareholders."},"configure(address)":{"notice":"Sets the media contract address. This address is the only permitted address that can call the mutable functions. This method can only be called once."},"isValidBid(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Validates that the bid is valid by ensuring that the bid amount can be split perfectly into all the bid shares. We do this by comparing the sum of the individual share values with the amount and ensuring they are equal. Because the splitShare function uses integer division, any inconsistencies with the original and split sums would be due to a bid splitting that does not perfectly divide the bid amount."},"isValidBidShares(((uint256),(uint256),(uint256)))":{"notice":"Validates that the provided bid shares sum to 100"},"removeAsk(uint256)":{"notice":"removes an ask for a token and emits an AskRemoved event"},"removeBid(uint256,address)":{"notice":"Removes the bid on a particular media for a bidder. The bid amount is transferred from this contract to the bidder, if they have a bid placed."},"setAsk(uint256,(uint256,address))":{"notice":"Sets the ask on a particular media. If the ask cannot be evenly split into the media's bid shares, this reverts."},"setBid(uint256,(uint256,address,address,address,(uint256)),address)":{"notice":"Sets the bid on a particular media for a bidder. The token being used to bid is transferred from the spender to this contract to be held until removed or accepted. If another bid already exists for the bidder, it is refunded."},"setBidShares(uint256,((uint256),(uint256),(uint256)))":{"notice":"Sets bid shares for a particular tokenId. These bid shares must sum to 100."},"splitShare((uint256),uint256)":{"notice":"return a % of the specified amount. This function is used to split a bid into shares for a media's shareholders."}},"notice":"This contract contains all of the market logic for documentation.text:
@title A Market for pieces of media
@notice This contract contains all of the market logic for Media
@notice require that the msg.sender is the configured media contract

typeDescriptions.typeString: mapping(uint256 => mapping(address => struct IMarket.Bid storage ref))
literal_string "Market: Invalid bid shares for token"

arguments.value: Market: Invalid bid shares for token

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Market: Invalid bid shares for token"

documentation.text:
@notice Validates that the bid is valid by ensuring that the bid amount can be split perfectly into all the bid shares.
 We do this by comparing the sum of the individual share values with the amount and ensuring they are equal. Because
 the splitShare function uses integer division, any inconsistencies with the original and split sums would be due to
 a bid splitting that does not perfectly divide the bid amount.
@notice Validates that the provided bid shares sum to 100

@notice return a % of the specified amount. This function is used to split a bid into shares
for a media's shareholders.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Market: cannot set media contract as zero address"

arguments.value: Market: cannot set media contract as zero address

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Market: cannot set media contract as zero address"

documentation.text:
@notice Sets the media contract address. This address is the only permitted address that
can call the mutable functions. This method can only be called once.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Market: Invalid bid shares, must sum to 100"

arguments.value: Market: Invalid bid shares, must sum to 100

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Market: Invalid bid shares, must sum to 100"

documentation.text:
@notice Sets bid shares for a particular tokenId. These bid shares must
sum to 100.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Market: Ask invalid for share splitting"

arguments.value: Market: Ask invalid for share splitting

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Market: Ask invalid for share splitting"

documentation.text:
@notice Sets the ask on a particular media. If the ask cannot be evenly split into the media's
bid shares, this reverts.
@notice removes an ask for a token and emits an AskRemoved event

documentation.text:
@notice Removes the bid on a particular media for a bidder. The bid amount
is transferred from this contract to the bidder, if they have a bid placed.

typeDescriptions.typeString: mapping(uint256 => mapping(address => struct IMarket.Bid storage ref))
literal_string "Market: Bid invalid for share splitting"

arguments.value: Market: Bid invalid for share splitting

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Market: Bid invalid for share splitting"

documentation.text:
@notice Accepts a bid from a particular bidder. Can only be called by the media contract.
See {_finalizeNFTTransfer}
Provided bid must match a bid in storage. This is to prevent a race condition
where a bid may change while the acceptBid call is in transit.
A bid cannot be accepted if it cannot be split equally into its shareholders.
This should only revert in rare instances (example, a low bid with a zero-decimal token),
but is necessary to ensure fairness to all shareholders.

typeDescriptions.typeString: mapping(uint256 => mapping(address => struct IMarket.Bid storage ref))
mapping(uint256 => mapping(address => struct IMarket.Bid storage ref))

attributes.text:
@title A Market for pieces of media
@notice This contract contains all of the market logic for Media
@notice require that the msg.sender is the configured media contract

attributes.type: mapping(uint256 => mapping(address => struct IMarket.Bid storage ref))

attributes.text:
@notice Validates that the bid is valid by ensuring that the bid amount can be split perfectly into all the bid shares.
 We do this by comparing the sum of the individual share values with the amount and ensuring they are equal. Because
 the splitShare function uses integer division, any inconsistencies with the original and split sums would be due to
 a bid splitting that does not perfectly divide the bid amount.

devdoc.title: A Market for pieces of media

acceptBid(uint256,(uint256,address,addre.notice: Accepts a bid from a particular bidder. Can only be called by the media contract. See {_finalizeNFTTransfer} Provided bid must match a bid in storage. This is to prevent a race condition where a bid may change while the acceptBid call is in transit. A bid cannot be accepted if it cannot be split equally into its shareholders. This should only revert in rare instances (example, a low bid with a zero-decimal token), but is necessary to ensure fairness to all shareholders.

configure(address).notice: Sets the media contract address. This address is the only permitted address that can call the mutable functions. This method can only be called once.

isValidBid(uint256,uint256).notice: Validates that the bid is valid by ensuring that the bid amount can be split perfectly into all the bid shares. We do this by comparing the sum of the individual share values with the amount and ensuring they are equal. Because the splitShare function uses integer division, any inconsistencies with the original and split sums would be due to a bid splitting that does not perfectly divide the bid amount.

isValidBidShares(((uint256),(uint256),(u.notice: Validates that the provided bid shares sum to 100

removeAsk(uint256).notice: removes an ask for a token and emits an AskRemoved event

removeBid(uint256,address).notice: Removes the bid on a particular media for a bidder. The bid amount is transferred from this contract to the bidder, if they have a bid placed.

setAsk(uint256,(uint256,address)).notice: Sets the ask on a particular media. If the ask cannot be evenly split into the media's bid shares, this reverts.

setBid(uint256,(uint256,address,address,.notice: Sets the bid on a particular media for a bidder. The token being used to bid is transferred from the spender to this contract to be held until removed or accepted. If another bid already exists for the bidder, it is refunded.

setBidShares(uint256,((uint256),(uint256.notice: Sets bid shares for a particular tokenId. These bid shares must sum to 100.

splitShare((uint256),uint256).notice: return a % of the specified amount. This function is used to split a bid into shares for a media's shareholders.

userdoc.notice: This contract contains all of the market logic for Media
